intro: Swertia chrysantha var. yezo-alpina, commonly known as the Yezo alpine swertia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. This variant is distinguished by its adaptation to cold climates and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
